title.vaccine_sequence: Rabies Vaccine and Serum by Month
title.location: Vaccine by Locations and Treatment Categories

label.total_var_sar_case: Number of human rabies cases receiving VAR and RIG

description.program_coverage: Summary information about geographic distribution (provinces and districts) and number of first-level community health facilities and referral hospital with rabies treatment services and health logistics-related activities.
description.rabies_vaccination:
Summary information related to total cases and logistics of vaccine anti-rabies (VAR) and rabies immunoglobulin (RIG). Information shown are total human rabies cases from animal bites receiving VAR and HRIG, total number of cases receiving VAR, total VAR doses administered, total number of cases receiving SAR, total SAR doses administered.

Title in scorecard:
description.patient_dose: The comparison of total doses of vaccine (VAR) and serum (SAR) dispensed for rabies care with the number of recipients.
description.vaccine_sequence: The monthly historical data of the number of rabies vaccine and serum dispensed for rabies care.
description.location: Total number of doses of material dispensed for rabies care by geographical location (provinces and regencies) and treatment categories (PrEP, PEP primary doses, PEP Booster). PrEP divided into PrEP I and PrEP II; PEP primary doses consists of PEP VAR I, VAR II, and VAR III; PEP Booster consists of Booster I and Booster II.
description.detail: Detail information about per material name, by entities, by geographical location, and it's actual transaction date.

care_cascade: The visual presents the outcomes across stages of recipientsâ€™s engagement in the health systems for rabies care. The cascade starts with Pre-exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP) and Post-exposure Prophylaxis (PEP). PrEP is administered twice: PrEP I and PrEP II with standard duration for administration of the second dose is 7 days after the first dose. The number of doses and the interval of administration for PrEP with Zagreb method are divided based on administration route, i.e., intra-muscular (IM) or intra-dermal (ID): 1-0-1-0-0 (IM) or 2-0-2-0-0 (ID).

The number of doses and the interval of administration for PEP with Zagreb method are divided based on administration route, i.e., intra-muscular (IM) or intra-dermal (ID): 2-0-1-0-1 (IM) or 2-2-2-0-0 (ID).
IM route: Day 0 (2 doses), Day 3 (0 dose), Day 7 (1 doses), Day 14 (0 dose), day 21/28 (1 dose).
ID route: Day 0 (2 doses), Day 3 (2 doses), Day 7 (2 doses), Day 14 (0 dose), Day 21/28 (0 dose).

If based on observation within 14 days the animal is healthy and the brain sample retrieved from the animal is found to be negative, then the third dose is not necessary or confirmed as not rabies case.

Booster is given if the victim who previously has received minimum 2 doses of PrEP or PEP got bitten after more than 3 months. The administration of second dose of booster is done in day 3 after the first dose. If the administration of PrEP, PEP, and Booster are not following the standard/ideal/recommended interval, then the number is grouped into fail to follow schedule for PrEP/PEP/Booster. If not taken the next sequence as recommended, then it counted as lost-to-follow up (LTFU).
